jobDescription: Job DescriptionOPEN TO CURRENT MDOT EMPLOYEES ONLY  As the data analyst, this position will conduct research and data analysis using National Bridge Inventory systems providing a range of professional research and analytical support to Structure Preservation and Management subject matter experts in Bridge Management Systems, Load Rating and Bridge Inspection. Functions include collect and provide bridge asset data to subject matter experts in compliance with National Bridge Inspection Standards (NBIS) and MDOT specifications and quality assurance procedures. Perform quality control reviews of Michigan Bridge Inventory to ensure quality data for asset management. Participate in the NBIS Compliance committee to insure professional data management using the National Bridge Inventory (NBI) data. Prepare reports to meet federal or state audit obligations. Determine the need for developing policy and proposing new statewide initiatives including the review of state and federal requirements as it relates to asset data and reporting of data. Provide training and support to MDOT staff, private and public agencies, and industry leaders for the development of training materials used during presentations. Administer MDOT's statewide Structure Inventory and Appraisal Manual. Create and maintain in office procedural manuals and provide support to their users. Design data queries based on subject matter experts needs and assist in planning, implementing, and evaluating bridge asset data; consolidate data and prepare reports. Train groups of others in the use of MiBridge. Provide inventory data reports for state and federal agencies, as well as for local entities.
